articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: The Taliban says US has agreed to provide humanitarian aid to Afghanistan during talks in Doha - ABC News
articles.description: American and Taliban officials have held talks in Doha, with a spokesman for the militant group saying the US will provide aid but is refusing to recognise Afghanistan's new rulers.
articles.content:
The US has agreed to provide humanitarian aid but refused to give political recognition to Afghanistan's new rulers, the Taliban says.
<ul><li>The US was less definitive, saying the two sides "discu… [+2681 chars]

articles.author: Richard Damerell
articles.title: Tyson Fury says Deontay Wilder refused to show 'sportsmanship' after he knocked out American in third fight - CNBC
articles.description: "I'm a sportsman. I went over to him to show some love and respect and he didn't want to give it back," Tyson Fury said.
articles.content:
Tyson Fury says Deontay Wilder did not want to show "sportsmanship or respect" after he had knocked out the American in their third WBC heavyweight title fight.
The British star finally ended his le… [+2043 chars]

articles.author: JOHN ANNESE
articles.title: Bomb scare that forced plane to land in NYC was misunderstanding - New York Daily News
articles.description: American Airlines Flight 4817 from Indianapolis — operated by Republic Airways — made an emergency landing at LaGuardia just after 3 p.m., and authorities took a suspicious passenger into custody for several hours.
articles.content: The security incident that forced a New-York bound flight to make an emergency landing at LaGuardia Airport on Saturday turned out to be a misunderstanding after an airline passenger mistook another … [+1327 chars]

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: 2022 World Cup Qualifiers: What we learned from Bafana Bafana's win over Ethiopia - Goal.com
articles.description: On the four-year anniversary of the lowest point in USMNT history, the Americans suffered their first loss in CONCACAF World Cup qualifying and for the first time ever it came against Panama.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: 'No Time To Die' gives Daniel Craig's last outing as James Bond the top box office spot in opening weekend - Fox Business
articles.description: After over 18 months of pandemic delays, “No Time to Die” opened on target. The final James Bond film of the Daniel Craig era grossed $56 million from 4,407 North American theaters, according to studio estimates on Sunday, to easily take the first-place spot.
